Articles.Content: OK, so I saw the anomalous forces on Moho thread and thought, "screw the Mun rover, time to head to Moho!" Unfortunately, I suck at building interplanetary rockets. So can someone help me, and, even better, point me toward a Moho landing tutorial? Thanks!

Moho landing Eh?

I can only fly with help from MechJeb (don't start ranting people), so I would recommend that.

When I get home, I'll post you my Universal Probe System lander, which I've used to get a (smallish, unmanned) payload to almost every system and body in KSP -- though landing on Tylo was beyond its power, Moho wasn't particularly hard. The nice thing about Moho is it orbits fast as hell, so it's easy to get your intercept. From there, landing's a lot like the Mun -- it's a light planet with low gravity and no air.
